overview: Job Grant is a one-off payment when you stop benefits and start work - how much you get, eligibility, apply
title: Job Grant

table.body:
You could get a £100 or £250 one-off payment when you stop claiming certain [benefits](job-grant/eligibility "Eligibility") because you're starting work. This is known as a Job Grant.  

You have to [qualify](/job-grant/eligibility "Eligibility") and any money you get:

+ doesn't have to be paid back 
+ won't affect your other benefits 
+ is tax-free 

% You must tell Jobcentre Plus you've started full-time work within 21 days of doing so to get a Job Grant. %
table.title: Overview

table.body:
The amount of Job Grant you can get is:

+ £100 - for single people and couples without children 
+ £250 - for lone parents and couples with children

When you start working, you can apply for [Extended Council Tax Benefit](/council-tax-benefit/further-information "Extended Council Tax Benefit") and [Extended Housing Benefit](/housing-benefit/further-information "Extended Housing Benefit") as well.

##How you're paid 

All benefits, pensions and allowances are [paid into an account](/how-to-have-your-benefits-paid "How you're paid"), eg a bank account.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
To qualify for a Job Grant you must: 

+ have started claiming the benefit before 1 October 2012
+ go straight from claiming benefits to starting work 
+ expect the work to last at least 5 weeks 
+ work at least 16 hours a week - this can be in different jobs

Also, you must have been getting one of these benefits for at least 26 weeks before starting work:

- Jobseeker's Allowance
- Income Support
- Employment and Support Allowance
- Incapacity Benefit
- Severe Disablement Allowance
- Jobcentre Plus/New Deal Allowance payments (where the allowance is based one of the above benefits)
- Employment Zone payments (where the allowance is based on Jobseeker's Allowance)

##Exceptions 

You might still qualify if your benefits have stopped because your partner is now working at least 24 hours a week and expects this to last 5 weeks or more.

% There will be no new Job Grant payments from 1 April 2013. %
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
To get a Job grant, tell [Jobcentre Plus](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"} you have started full-time work within 21 days of doing so.

If you qualify, the money is paid automatically when your benefit claim is closed.

##Appeal a decision 

You can appeal the decision about your Job Grant if you're unhappy with it.
